item.title: Trip hazard on pavements outside 177 Whitehorse Hill.Also 179 and 175, 11th July
item.description:
These pavements are dangerous and need repairing properly. The ones outside 177 especially are a trip hazard and they all need to be fixed properly. On a regular basis the ones outside 175 get repaired and they break a week later as they are not done properly. I have lived in my property 23 years, 177 White Horse Hill and these pavements are a complete mess and dangerous to the public and never get fixed properly. If they were bedded in properly in the first place they wouldn't need mending so often.Pavements as you go more towards Chislehurst village are kept in good repair so why not ours too.They have been like this for at least 6 months but are getting worse.There are a lot of old people and disabled people who walk along here with sticks and it is a danger to them .Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Horse Hill, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Political Sign on Bridge, 11th July
item.description:
This sign was posted last night by one of the canal boats, it's very difficult to remove and reads "BBC Censorship Protects Israel's Genocide" - it also directly faces the nursery, so young children get to read this sign. Would be great to get it removed.

item.title: Camouflaged Curb - how have the council not addressed this?, 11th July
item.description:
Yesterday I badly sprained my ankle outside of the Ralph Lauren store opposite Cartier. I didn’t notice the change in pavement height, albeit not that significant, it was still enough to do serious damage and it was actually probably worse it wasn’t higher. It is too low, not clearly marked as being a change in height and as the brick pattern is the same on the pavement than that of the road, it is essentially camouflaged. What is worse and really disappointing is that the council appear to know of this issue and not doing anything about it. When I was being assisted by paramedics yesterday the staff from Ralph Lauren said this happened all of the time. And reporting it on here I can see it is a common occurrence. Please can I implore the council to do something to make this curb more apparent? I appreciate it might not be visually appealing to paint it yellow, but surely safety is more important than aesthetics?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 173, New Bond Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gully, 11th July
item.description:
The is a surface water gully in the road outside my house. It was blocked so I organised for it to be cleared by the quality drainage company. They have found it is just a chamber and is not actually connected to the surface water mains. Would it be possible to look into this at it seems it blocks during heavy rain and floods the area. My house is graylings, Camden way, br7 5HT. Kind regards Sam Clouter
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Way, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
